Description: Pale yellowish-green glass gem; underside engraved with a plunging bull with its head turned back (or jumping lion?). Pierced lengthwise.
Curator's comments: It can be compared with another glass gem from Naukratis, which might have been produced locally (Cairo, Egyptian Museum JE39123) during the Augustan period, or at least not earlier than the late Ptolemaic period.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (581)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 43, pl. XX, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.22) (phase 3)
Boardman J 1970 / Greek Gems and Finger Rings: Early Bronze Age to Late Classical (p. 416, no. 581)
